Buffeted by Trump, India seeks to strengthen ties with Russia and China
subhead: Threatened by Washington with 50% tariffs, India, under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has responded by turning to its powerful neighbors. The Indian foreign minister is set to visit Russia soon, while the Chinese foreign minister is expected in New Delhi on Monday.
byline: By Sophie Landrin (New Delhi, India, correspondent)

title: Israelis rally nationwide calling for end to Gaza war, hostage deal
subhead: The protests come more than a week after Israel's security cabinet approved plans to capture Gaza City, following 22 months of war that have created dire humanitarian conditions in the Palestinian territory.

title: After Anchorage summit, Europeans stand firmly behind Zelensky in the face of Trump
subhead: Several leaders from across Europe are set to travel to Washington on Monday with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to meet with the American president. The Ukrainian crisis now pits Kyiv and the main European governments against Moscow and Washington.

title: The lobo-guará, Brazil's maned wolf, a national icon under threat
subhead: Emblematic of the Cerrado, these animals have seen their habitat fragmented by deforestation and the spread of industrial agriculture. In the state of Minas Gerais, a sanctuary now shelters some of them, aiming to raise public awareness.
byline: By Bruno Meyerfeld (Caraça Sanctuary (Brazil), special correspondent)

title: 'It is Jesus who speaks through me': The enigmatic life of Marthe Robin
subhead: 'Marthe Robin, Saint Or Fraud?' (1/5). In the 1920s, a paralyzed and bedridden farmer's daughter became a Catholic mystic known for her supernatural visions, and crowds flocked to see her until she died in 1981.

title: Henri Matisse and his heirs: The end of a financial windfall
subhead: Since Henri Matisse's death in 1954, four generations of his family have guarded his vast body of work jealously and with the utmost discretion. But when the painter's work entered the public domain in January, it ended the lucrative reproduction rights the heirs had enjoyed, as well as their oversight of everything concerning their ancestor.
byline: By Roxana Azimi and Clément Ghys

title: Haitham Karajay, chef: 'My mother cooked every day. I was lucky to have her by my side until she died'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (6/6). Chef Haitham Karajay sought refuge in France to escape from the Syrian civil war. He quickly turned to cooking, with the support of the NGO Refugee Food, for which he now works.

title: 'Who will survive?': How 'Game of Thrones' staged an unprecedented bloodbath
subhead: 'Breaking the Script' (4/5). On June 2, 2013, the end of the third season of 'Game of Thrones' stunned viewers by depicting the brutal murder of one of the saga's houses, in an episode that immediately went viral on social media. The carnage sparked a trend of aestheticized violence in television fiction series. Spoiler alert!
